name: multipolar
content:
multipolar adjective
(POWER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
politics
  specialized involving several countries having most of the power: The President spoke of a multi-polar world. The world financial system is becoming multipolar. Compare
bipolar adjective (POWER) specialized
More examplesFewer examplesSome believe that a multipolar system leads to more flexible and stable relationships in international politics.In many ways, in our modern world, no one is in control. The world is too multi-polar, too fractured and divided.

multipolar adjective
(CELL)
anatomy, biology
  specialized (of a cell) having several structures projecting (= sticking out) from it: The cell is multipolar, with one axon and multiple dendrites. One broad category in our research involves multipolar cells. Compare
bipolar adjective (CELL) specialized
More examplesFewer examplesThese are the double-spindled and multipolar types of cells which occur in hybrids. These neurons were pyramidal and multipolar.

multipolar adjective
(SEVERAL PARTS)
formal consisting of several parts, choices, etc., especially when these are very different to each other: We need a way to deal with multi-polar questions. Some legal proceedings are by nature more multipolar. Compare
bipolar adjective (TWO PARTS)
